alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 4:47PM MST until August 22 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST /945 PM MDT/. * At 446 PM MST /546 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starting Water Wash Slot Canyon, Tower Butte, Cardiac Canyon, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell. This includes the following slot canyons... Butterfly Canyon, West Canyon Creek, Canyon X and Labyrinth Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Kaibito Creek, Navajo Creek, Peach Wash, Antelope Creek, Starting Water Wash, Last Chance Creek, West Canyon Creek and Sand Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
